content.description: A fair route with bouldery movement. This route starts hard with an early crux then eases up from there. Finish on the face at a chain anchor. Good quality rock with some great exposure, awkward and technical climbing!
content.location:
This line is the bolted route located just left of

11th Commandment

.

content.description: This is a mixed line that starts just to the left of The Tempest. Pull up the face to clip a pin, then continue through a bolt and up the face trending left. Belay at the top on gear, it may also be possible to access the anchors for The Tempest.
content.protection: Small cams, small wires, quickdraws, sling belay.
content.location: Located just to the left of The Tempest, on the left corner of the wall right of the break that forms a large ledge above.

content.description:
A full value extension to Low Fat Turkey Dog.

Clip L.F.T.D. anchor, shake out the pump if you can, move out left, clip bolt and punch it through the awesome crux to some easier ground before the head wall. From here, two options exist using the same bolt line: either move left and climb the tricky arete (5.11+, keeping the grade at 12d), or move right onto the amazing and hard face crux (5.13a).
content.protection:
Bolts, quickdraws and chain anchor.

35 meter route! 70m rope gets you to the ground.
content.location: This route begins by doing L.F.T.D., which starts right of Relativity and an open project and left of razorback. Start in corner and bust out left on steep angling climbing.

content.description: Route follows a corner and then pulls a bulge at the top for the crux. Somewhat of a one move wonder. Can be TR'd by climbing the easy crack around to the left.
content.location: Located on the far left side of the First Buttress, past the corner and 50 yds up the gully.

content.description: A very long and sustained route, no gimme for the grade. Pull the first bulge to a good rest under the roof, then step left using the finger crack in the roof to continue up the face. Pull through multiple cruxes, with another small roof towards the very top. Well protected and very fun. A 70m is a must to TR, or bring two 60 m ropes and rappel off.
content.location: Located to the left of The Brick, and right of Uncontrollable Desire. Starts below a roof and an obvious bombay.

content.description: After the initial slab, climb sustained ground  through the roof and trend left following the bolts up the natural weakness(power endurance crimping). A series of dynamic moves followed by a short mellow section, with a potential chance to recover, brings you to a fun V5/6 boulder problem finish to the chains.
content.location: Start on short slab just right of the Hilti Traverse.

content.description: This route starts up a long slab then starts up the face right of the large arete. Pull through some great face climbing to gain a ledge. From here do an airy and awesome traverse to gain the arete proper and continue to chains.
content.protection: quickdraws, chain anchors, 1 or .75 camalot optional to protect the moves below first bolt
content.location: Route is located on the right side of the first buttress, just left of the enormous overhang. Look for the prominent arete with bolts up the right side.

content.description:
The route starts off with an isolated V4/5 boulder problem that brings you to a no hands rest below the first perma-draw. 5.12 climbing brings you to a rest before a sustained and thought provoking V7 boulder problem all the way to the anchors. This route = power-endurance.

The 7th bolt is more of a "project bolt". It serves more as a way to suss out the boulder problem so as not to take a bajillion whips while figuring it out. It is a hard draw to clip on the go and creates some unecessary rope drag.
content.location: Pressure Drop is located on Cowboy Ledge just to the left of Cowboy Ejector Seat. Shares the first bolt of Cowboy Ejector Seat.

content.description:
This aesthetic, steep, power-endurance test piece could be a classic anywhere - wickedly good!

O.T.R. starts with a steep, powerful bouldery crux, then trends up and left with sustained pumpy climbing on excellent rock, utilizing crimps, slopers, jugs, heal hooks and heel-toe cams...  A cruxy section gets you below the large roof and into a strenuous kneebar that sets you up for the unobvious, yet rad crux. Do the last hard moves off heel hooks and slopers, then continue up on big holds and steep rock to the chains.
content.protection:
8 bolts: 3 QDs and 5 permadraws.

Chain anchor with lower off biners.
content.location: Cautiously scramble up to "Cowboy" ledge and traverse right past Cowboy Ejector Seat to a bolted belay below the steepest part of the wall.

climbs.name: Odorous Whim
climbs.fa: Cam Burns, Steve Porcella, & Galen Rowell (1991)

content.description: Start on the left side of the face near the ledgy/broken corner. Climb lower face trending slightly right to second bolt at small roof. Pull the roof, then continue through slabby upper face to chains.
content.protection: Quickdraws (5-6), Chain Anchors. Optional small cam to protect moves below first bolt. Optional medium cam to tame runout on upper face.
content.location: On the face right of Ironmonger. Fifteen feet left of Moses.

content.description: Climb up the face and pull the roof, continue on upper face through two bolts to the anchors, which are a little on the right.
content.protection: quickdraws, small to medium gear, chain anchors
content.location: located 15 ft to the right of look out it's 10d.

content.description: A great line that starts in a overhanging corner system and then pulls left in overhanging terrain through crimpy and dynamic moves. A good rest can be had by stepping right out of the corner to the large ledge, but this may be cheating. The line may be rated 12c/d if you don't stem to the wall on your right.
content.location: This route is on the right side of the 1st buttress, right of the hilti traverse and left of razorback. Marked by a 20ft slab to get to the start, then a large corner.

content.description: A thin line that ascends the right side of the large orange face at the top of the wall. vertical and very crimpy. Belay anchors located at the bottom of the climb.
content.location: This route is located on the large orange face on the left side of the first buttress. Sits just right of a rockwork orange. Gain the belay anchors by climbing either the corner or iron monger.

content.description: Long and varied climb, goes to the top of the cliffband. Be prepared for a little route finding (not too bad), building an anchor, and a walkoff. This route can also be used to access a Rockwork Orange and Kyle's 12.
content.protection: single rack and stoppers, chain anchors
content.location: This route is right of Botulism and left of Look Out Its 10d. Starts as a thin and ledgy crack that goes up to a very small roof and over onto a slabby face. The 2nd pitch heads up a corner with a large tree on a ledge.

content.description:
Climb up runout 5.7 to a bolt, this is where the real climbing begins. Climb the arcing dihedral to awkward leaning rails then pull the crux through the v-notched roof. A few more moderate moves will bring you to the anchors in an alcove.

Definition of Hoodwinked: to be deceived or tricked...
content.protection: 5 bolts plus 2 at the anchor. The beginning 5.7 runout can be protected with a #1 and #2 camalot.
content.location: Hoodwink is right of Apiary. It is the left facing dihedral. You can belay from the ground or on a ledge 15 ft off the ground.

content.description: This line is just left of Hilti. Starts up the slab and then through the roof to a corner. From the corner, pull the arete and continue to anchors.
content.location: Route is located just to the right of Hilti. Look for the corner above the roof.

content.description: High Wire is the crack line just left of Town Pump. Heads up face and bolts, then up corner to top.
content.location: Route is located on the left side of the First Buttress, up the gully and just left of Town Pump.

content.description: While this route offers some high quality climbing, it is really more of a direct extension of "Hilti" into the upper crux of "Relativity". Begin by making some powerful pulls between relatively good holds through the "Hilti" roof to reach a good rest. From here, continue up through sustained, and at times sequential, 5.11+ climbing on slopers, pinches, crimps, gastons, and underclings to another good rest where the route connects with "Relativity" as it angles in from the right. Take a moment to relax and enjoy the view while you shakeout before punching it through the short, but tricky, final boulder problem guarding the chains.
content.protection: 11 bolts, quickdraws, and shared chain anchors with "Relativity".
content.location: This route starts on "Hilti", which shares its first bolt with "The Arborist" before heading through the right side of the prominent roof. "Relativity" is the next route to the right.

content.description: A varied and tricky climb, invokes some thoughtful climbing. A bit pumpy while you try and find your way. Follow the bolt line, which diverts from the prominent weakness a bit.
content.location: This route is just right of 11th Commandment. One of the first you will come to from the approach trail.

content.description:
Start up Relativity and after the first roof where Rel. goes up and left, continue up and right slapping pinches and slopers with wild footwork through a V7/8 crux and finish up at the chains for Low Fat Turkey Dog.

Strong boulderer? Get on this one.
content.location: Start on the slab at the base of Relativity. Clip the first two bolts and jet up and right.

content.description: Dymaxion is characterized by steep, pumpy climbing with big moves between big holds. From the belay bolt, make fun exposed moves traversing up and right through the first roof on surprisingly large holds. Doing the thinnest moves on the route, pull up onto the face and continue on spaced jugs through the next roof and pump your way to the anchors...
content.protection: Cautiously scramble up to "Cowboy" ledge and traverse to the furthest right side, passing the corner with bolts, to a single bolt belay anchor.
content.location: 6 quick draws, sport anchors

content.description: After climbing through the beginning of LFTD, climb up and right through steep rock and over the bulge to a rest. Recover and continue through some more steep climbing to another rest. Decipher the sequence through the headwall and you've done it! Rope drag can be a sorta bad at the top if you don't extend some draws lower down. If you want, use a long draw on the last bolt of Low Fat Turkey Dogs right before the permadraw and extend the next two draws just past the permadraw. Enjoy!
content.location: Climbs the first 5 bolts of Low Fat Turkey Dogs then goes directly up through the roof.

content.description:
The

Cowboy Ejector Seat

climbs the overhang in the middle of the first buttress.
content.protection:
Bolts, chain anchors with lowering biners, 2 fixed draws.

Take a couple of extendable draws. At the no hands rest just after the first roof, clip the bolt with a sling and a quickdraw and this will keep your rope off the rock.
content.location: Located on the far right side of the first buttress, goes through the left side of the big overhang. Just left of Razorback and climbs the same slab to access the start.

content.description: Lower angled corner that trends right toward the big orange face. Fun climbing with good gear, some loose rock, but not to bad. Can be used to access A Rockwork Orange or Kyle's 12.
content.protection: Single rack and stoppers. Chain anchors on top of first and second pitches.
content.location: This is located at the far left side of the First Buttress, where the wall turns uphill and heads up the gully. Start by the large tree at the arete and climb the broken corner to a large ledge.

content.description: Sustained 12 climbing with a high crux. Very clean crimping after pulling a tricky roof.
content.location: This is directly right of The Tempest, 2 routes right of the long blank section after Eleventh Commandment area.

content.description: A slightly overhanging start leads to a short but powerful crux to reach the upper slab. Fun moves through a small roof.
content.protection: Quickdraws, chain anchors, optional small cam to protect the upper face/slab.
content.location: This route is on the left side of the First Buttress, just left of Iron Monger. Goes up bolted face to pull through a small roof.

content.description:
Walks a fine line of being a squeeze, but with unique, independent  and high quality climbing, the Barborits is well worth doing.

Get a mediocre rest after the first crux of the BRIK and traverse right on small edges to the first bolt of the Barborist. Crank the fun, sequential and hard crux that culminates  with a big toss to a jug.  Continue on relatively moderate climbing to the steep pumpy upper crux (mid 12) with powerful side pulls and desperate last moves.  Mantle ledge and clip a shared anchor with The Arborist.
content.protection:
Quick draws, anchors with lower off biners.

A shoulder length draw on the BRIK's 4th bolt (painted red) helps reduce drag.
content.location: The route begins with the first 4 bolts (the lower crux) of The BRIK and goes hard right where the BRIK trends left. Climb past 5 more bolts to a shared anchor with The Arborist.

content.description: One of the hardest climbs at Kootenai, goes through the steepest and thinnest terrain on the first buttress. Sustained hard moves through multiple roofs.
content.location: This route is directly right of the brik, heads up a short easy face then directly into the first roof of the route.

content.description: Climb black water streak to a great rest, crank through an interesting sequence through the roof, and  make a powerful deadpoint to a jug. Gather yourself and climb steep jugs to chains. Often a crack below the roof seeps in the winter and spring.
content.location: To the right of Cowboy Ejector Seat, basically where first buttress begins.

content.description: A very thin and technical face, interesting and exciting climbing that can feel a little insecure. A Classic line that can take a little thought to work through.
content.protection: Small cams and wires, quickdraws, chain anchors.
content.location: This is the large blank looking orange face that hangs above the first buttress. It can be accessed by climbing either the corner or the first pitch of Iron Monger. There are anchors to belay from.

content.description:
Climb through the crux of the Aborist and traverse left to the rest on the Barborist. Recover what you can and send it through the second crux of the Barborist.

Combines what I think are the two best crux sequences that I've climbed in Kootenai.
content.location: Start on Aborist, end on Barborist.

content.description: One of the most trafficked climbs in the canyon, among the few 10's on the buttress. Climb blocky start to high first bolt, and then up through white crystally rock. Careful of the greasy holds below the first bolt.
content.location: This route is right at the end of the approach trail, the first route that you will come to. Look for the large section of white rock.
